headline: Arm hires Amazon AI exec to boost plans to build its own chips
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Arm Holdings has hired Amazon.com artificial intelligence chip director Rami Sinno to bolster its plans to develop its own complete chips, a person familiar with the matter said on Monday.  Sinno was responsible for helping to develop Amazon's homegrown AI chips called Trainium and Inferentia that are designed to help build and run large AI applications.  Until now, Arm has not built its own chips.

headline: How to Play INTC Stock as the Intel Soap Opera Turns from Horror to Suspense
summary: Intel stock has been a soap opera of sorts over the last year, with record losses, leadership changes, acquisition rumors, and now reports of the U.S. government buying a stake.

headline: Latest News In AI Chips - Lantronix Advances AI Tech for Defense with Teal Drones
summary: Lantronix Inc. has announced a significant development in the realm of AI chips by providing a TAA and NDAA-compliant solution for Teal Drones' Black Widow™ drones, which are part of the U.S. Army’s Short-Range Reconnaissance (SRR) Program. This solution leverages the Qualcomm® Dragonwing™ QRB5165 processor to deliver advanced Edge AI capabilities while adhering to stringent security requirements. By ensuring compliance with U.S. standards, Lantronix is positioning itself as a key player in...
